articles.title: 6.3 million homes and properties in UK currently 'at serious risk' of flooding

Early deaths from heatwaves are projected to rise from the 3,000 seen in 2022's record hot summer to 10,000 a year by mid-century. Half the UK's prime agricultural farmland is at risk from flooding. Schools, hospitals and care homes are among the most vulnerable to impacts such as heatwaves.

articles.title: Hedging our bets: the existential questions facing Australia's next government in unpredictable times
articles.author: Ben Doherty
articles.summary: The world is a more dangerous place. Global conflicts have doubled over the past five years. In 2024 alone, one person in eight was exposed to conflict. Australia is caught between two global giants: its 'great and powerful friend' and security benefactor, the US, and an assertive military power that is also its largest trading partner, China. Donald Trump's unpredictability makes it hard to be an US ally right now.

articles.title: As global players focus on the Arctic, US icebreakers are scarce

The region harbors roughly a quarter of the unexplored oil and natural gas reserves on earth and 150 rare earth deposits worth around $1 trillion. The Arctic Ocean is an area of unusual importance and a natural zone of conflict due to its geographic value. It is across the North Pole that the United States and Russia lie in closest proximity, making the Arctic seas an arena of rivalry in the nuclear age.
